title: JavaControlStatements - Q0001
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is a conditional control statement in Java?
explanation: The 'if' statement is a conditional control statement used to make decisions.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0002
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is an iterative control statement?
explanation: The 'for' loop is an iterative control statement used for repetition.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0003
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to terminate a loop prematurely?
explanation: The 'break' statement terminates a loop or switch statement prematurely.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0004
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement skips the current iteration of a loop?
explanation: The 'continue' statement skips the current iteration and moves to the next.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0005
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to exit from a method?
explanation: The 'return' statement exits from a method and optionally returns a value.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0006
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to handle multiple conditions efficiently?
explanation: The 'switch' statement handles multiple conditions efficiently.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0007
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which keyword is used to specify a default case in a switch statement?
explanation: The 'default' keyword specifies the block to execute if no case matches.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0008
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which loop executes at least once regardless of the condition?
explanation: The 'do-while' loop executes the block at least once before checking the condition.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0009
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which loop is best suited when the number of iterations is known?
explanation: The 'for' loop is best suited when the number of iterations is known.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0010
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which loop is best suited when the number of iterations is unknown?
explanation: The 'while' loop is used when the number of iterations is unknown.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0011
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to handle exceptions?
explanation: The 'try-catch' block is used to handle exceptions.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0012
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which block always executes after try-catch?
explanation: The 'finally' block always executes after try-catch, regardless of exceptions.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0013
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to throw an exception manually?
explanation: The 'throw' keyword is used to manually throw an exception.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0014
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which keyword is used in a method signature to declare exceptions?
explanation: The 'throws' keyword declares exceptions that a method can throw.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0015
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to handle multiple conditions compactly?
explanation: The ternary operator (condition ? value1 : value2) handles conditions compactly.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0016
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to exit from multiple nested loops?
explanation: A labeled break statement can exit multiple nested loops.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0017
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement transfers control to the next iteration of the labeled loop?
explanation: A labeled continue statement skips to the next iteration of the labeled loop.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0018
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to terminate the program execution?
explanation: System.exit(0) terminates the program execution.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0019
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to handle multiple exceptions in one block?
explanation: Multiple exceptions can be handled using the '|' operator in a single catch block.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0020
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which statement is used to rethrow an exception after handling it?
explanation: The 'throw' statement can rethrow an exception after handling.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0021
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the if-else statement?

options.text: It can only check one condition
It can check multiple conditions using else if
It cannot have an else block
It must always have an else block

explanation: The if-else statement can check multiple conditions using else if.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0022
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the switch statement?

options.text: It can evaluate strings and enums
It cannot have a default case

explanation: The switch statement can evaluate strings, enums, and integral types.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0023
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] What happens if break is omitted in a switch case?
explanation: Without break, execution falls through to subsequent cases.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0024
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is a valid for loop syntax?
explanation: The correct syntax is for(initialization; condition; increment).

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0025
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is a valid while loop syntax?
explanation: The condition in a while loop must be enclosed in parentheses.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0026
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is a valid do-while loop syntax?
explanation: The correct syntax is do { } while (condition);

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0027
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the for-each loop?

options.text: It can iterate over arrays and collections
It can only iterate over integers
It can modify the collection size
It cannot be used with arrays

explanation: The for-each loop is used to iterate over arrays and collections.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0028
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is a valid for-each loop syntax?
explanation: The correct syntax is for (type variable : collection).

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0029
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following statements about break and continue is true?
explanation: The break statement terminates the loop immediately.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0030
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about nested loops?

options.text: A loop inside another loop is not allowed
The inner loop executes completely for each iteration of the outer loop
The outer loop executes completely for each iteration of the inner loop
Nested loops are only allowed in while loops

explanation: In nested loops, the inner loop executes completely for each iteration of the outer loop.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0031
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the ternary operator?

options.text: It can only be used with integers

explanation: The ternary operator requires three operands: condition ? value1 : value2.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0032
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about labeled loops?

options.text: They allow breaking out of multiple loops
They are not supported in Java
They can only be used with while loops
They can only be used with for loops

explanation: Labeled loops allow breaking or continuing specific outer loops.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0033
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the return statement?
explanation: The return statement exits from a method and optionally returns a value.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0034
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the switch statement in Java 14 and later?
explanation: Java 14 introduced switch expressions with arrow labels (->).

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0035
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the while loop?

options.text: It checks the condition before execution
It checks the condition after execution

explanation: The while loop checks the condition before executing the loop body.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0036
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the do-while loop?

options.text: It checks the condition before execution

explanation: The do-while loop executes at least once before checking the condition.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0037
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the for loop?

options.text: Initialization, condition, and increment are optional
It must have all three parts

explanation: All three parts of a for loop are optional, allowing infinite loops.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0038
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about infinite loops?

options.text: They can be created using while(true)
They can be created using for(;;)
They can be terminated using break

explanation: Infinite loops can be created using while(true) or for(;;) and terminated using break.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0039
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about nested if statements?

options.text: They are not allowed in Java
They allow multiple levels of condition checking
They must have an else block

explanation: Nested if statements allow multiple levels of condition checking.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0040
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the break statement?

options.text: It can be used outside loops
It can only be used inside loops or switch statements

explanation: The break statement can only be used inside loops or switch statements.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0041
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the continue statement?
explanation: The continue statement skips the current iteration and moves to the next.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0042
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the return statement in a void method?

options.text: It can be used to exit the method early

explanation: The return statement can be used to exit a void method early.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0043
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the switch statement fall-through behavior?

options.text: It executes all subsequent cases until a break

explanation: Without a break, the switch statement falls through to subsequent cases.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0044
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the default case in a switch statement?

options.text: It must be the first case
It must be the last case

explanation: The default case can appear anywhere in a switch statement.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0045
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the enhanced switch expression?
explanation: Enhanced switch expressions can return values directly.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0046
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the if statement?

options.text: It must have an else block
It can exist without an else block
It must contain a return statement

explanation: An if statement can exist without an else block.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0047
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about nested switch statements?

options.text: They are allowed and can be nested inside cases
They must have a default case

explanation: Switch statements can be nested inside other switch cases.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0048
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the for-each loop?

options.text: It can modify the collection size
It cannot modify the collection size
It can iterate over primitive types only

explanation: The for-each loop cannot modify the collection size.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0049
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following is true about the break statement in nested loops?

options.text: It breaks only the inner loop

explanation: The break statement breaks only the innermost loop unless labeled.

title: JavaControlStatements - Q0050
text: [Java Basics - Control Statements] Which of the following best describes control statements in Java?

options.text: They control the flow of execution in a program
They are used for input and output

explanation: Control statements control the flow of execution in a program.
